title: [K-12] Strengthening Competency in Analyzing the Pedagogical Suitability of Mathematics Textbook Lessons

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding middle school mathematics basic concepts (ratios, proportional relationships, etc.), foundational pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Program for pre-service secondary mathematics teachers to develop the ability to analyze the pedagogical suitability of mathematics textbooks. Conducted through formative assessment-centered self-directed learning using digital tools.

learning_goals: Apply a systematic framework to analyze pedagogical suitability in mathematics textbook lesson design

Learners select three textbook topics related to proportionality, create tables analyzing the alignment between learning objectives-activities-assessments for each topic, and achieve an average score of 4.0 or higher on a 5-point rubric through peer evaluations and instructor feedback

Learners can analyze formative assessment results (items with less than 70% correct answer rates) to diagnose three major limitations of textbook materials (e.g., content errors, insufficient explanations, lack of practical applicability) and propose 1â€“2 improvement strategies per limitation (e.g., adding case studies, revising terminology, linking to practical exercises).

resources: Digital educational content creation tools (Canva, Miricanvas, etc.)
Online collaboration platforms for feedback (Padlet, Google Docs, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
